Name: accounts.calendar.accounts
Desc: List of calendars.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.enable
Desc: Whether to enable khal access.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.addresses
Desc:
Email addresses to be associated with this account. Used to check the
participation status (“PARTSTAT”), refer to khal documentation.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.color
Desc:
Color in which events in this calendar are displayed.
For instance ‘light green’ or an RGB color ‘#ff0000’

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.glob
Desc:
The glob expansion to be searched for events or birthdays when
type is set to discover.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.priority
Desc: Priority of a calendar used for coloring (calendar with highest priority is preferred).

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.readOnly
Desc: Keep khal from making any changes to this account.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.khal.type
Desc: Either a single calendar (calendar which is the default) or a directory with multiple calendars (discover).

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.local
Desc: Local configuration for the calendar.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.local.encoding
Desc:
File encoding for items, both content and file name.
Defaults to UTF-8.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.local.fileExt
Desc: The file extension to use.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.local.path
Desc: The path of the storage.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.local.type
Desc: The type of the storage.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.name
Desc:
Unique identifier of the calendar. This is set to the
attribute name of the calendar configuration.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.primary
Desc:
Whether this is the primary account. Only one account may be
set as primary.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.primaryCollection
Desc:
The primary collection of the account. Required when an
account has multiple collections.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.qcal.enable
Desc: Whether to enable qcal access.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.remote
Desc: Remote configuration for the calendar.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.remote.passwordCommand
Desc: A command that prints the password to standard output.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.remote.type
Desc: The type of the storage.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.remote.url
Desc: The URL of the storage.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.remote.userName
Desc: User name for authentication.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.enable
Desc: Whether to enable synchronization using vdirsyncer.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.auth
Desc: Authentication settings. The default is <code class="literal">basic

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.authCert
Desc:
Either a path to a certificate with a client certificate and
the key or a list of paths to the files with them.
Type: null or string or list of string

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.clientIdCommand
Desc:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.clientSecretCommand
Desc:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.collections
Desc: The collections to synchronize between the storages.
Type: null or (list of (string or list of string))

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.conflictResolution
Desc:
What to do in case of a conflict between the storages. Either
<code class="literal">remote wins
Type: null or one of “remote wins”, “local wins” or list of string

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.itemTypes
Desc:
Kinds of items to show. The default is to show everything.
This depends on particular features of the server, the results
are not validated.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.metadata
Desc:
Metadata keys that should be synchronized when vdirsyncer
metasync is executed.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.partialSync
Desc:
What should happen if synchronization in one direction
is impossible due to one storage being read-only.
Defaults to <code class="literal">revert

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.postHook
Desc:
Command to call for each item creation and modification.
The command will be called with the path of the new/updated
file.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange
Desc:
A time range to synchronize. start and end can be any Python
expression that returns a <code class="literal">datetime.datetime

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange.end
Desc: End of time range to show.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange.start
Desc: Start of time range to show.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.tokenFile
Desc: A file path where access tokens are stored.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.urlCommand
Desc: A command that prints the URL of the storage.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.userAgent
Desc:
The user agent to report to the server. Defaults to
<code class="literal">vdirsyncer

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.userNameCommand
Desc: A command that prints the user name to standard output.

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.verify
Desc: Null or path to certificate to verify SSL against

Name: accounts.calendar.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.verifyFingerprint
Desc: Optional. SHA1 or MD5 fingerprint of the expected server certificate.

Name: accounts.calendar.basePath
Desc:
The base directory in which to save calendars. May be a
relative path, in which case it is relative the home
directory.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.remote.userName

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.enable

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.auth

Desc:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.collections
Desc: The collections to synchronize between the storages.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.conflictResolution
Desc:
What to do in case of a conflict between the storages. Either

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.itemTypes

Kinds of items to show. The default is to show everything.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.metadata

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.partialSync

What should happen if synchronization in one direction

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.postHook
Desc:
Command to call for each item creation and modification.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange
Desc:
A time range to synchronize. start and end can be any Python

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange.end
Desc: End of time range to show.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.timeRange.start

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.tokenFile
Desc: A file path where access tokens are stored.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.urlCommand
Desc: A command that prints the URL of the storage.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.userAgent
Desc:
The user agent to report to the server. Defaults to

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.userNameCommand
Desc: A command that prints the user name to standard output.

Name: accounts.contact.accounts._name_.vdirsyncer.verify
Desc: Null or path to certificate to verify SSL against

Name: accounts.email.accounts
Desc: List of email accounts.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.address
Desc: The email address of this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.enable
Desc: Whether to enable aerc.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.extraAccounts
Desc:
Extra config added to the configuration section for this account in
<code class="filename">$HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf
Type: attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.extraBinds
Desc:
Extra bindings specific to this account, added to
<code class="filename">$HOME/.config/aerc/binds.conf
Type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.extraConfig
Desc: Config specific to this account, added to <code class="filename">$HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf
Type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.imapAuth
Desc:
Sets the authentication mechanism if imap is used as the incoming
method.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">aerc-imap

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.imapOauth2Params
Desc:
Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">aerc-imap

Desc: The OAuth2 client identifier.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.imapOauth2Params.client_secret
Desc: The OAuth2 client secret.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.imapOauth2Params.scope
Desc: The OAuth2 requested scope.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.imapOauth2Params.token_endpoint
Desc: The OAuth2 token endpoint.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpAuth
Desc:
Sets the authentication mechanism if smtp is used as the outgoing
method.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">aerc-smtp

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpOauth2Params
Desc:
Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">aerc-imap

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.client_id
Desc: The OAuth2 client identifier.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.client_secret
Desc: The OAuth2 client secret.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.scope
Desc: The OAuth2 requested scope.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.token_endpoint
Desc: The OAuth2 token endpoint.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.aliases
Desc: Alternative email addresses of this account.
Type: list of string matching the pattern .*@.*

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.alot.contactCompletion
Desc:
Contact completion configuration as expected per alot.
See <a class="link" href="http://alot.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration/contacts_completion.html"  target="_top">alot’s wiki

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.alot.extraConfig
Desc: Extra settings to add to this Alot account configuration.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.alot.sendMailCommand
Desc:
Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
<span class="command"><strong>msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.astroid.enable
Desc: Whether to enable Astroid.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.astroid.extraConfig
Desc: Extra settings to add to this astroid account configuration.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.astroid.sendMailCommand
Desc:
Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
<span class="command"><strong>msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.flavor
Desc:
Some email providers have peculiar behavior that require
special treatment. This option is therefore intended to
indicate the nature of the provider.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.folders
Desc: Standard email folders.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.folders.drafts
Desc: Relative path of the drafts mail folder.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.folders.inbox
Desc: Relative path of the inbox mail.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.folders.sent
Desc: Relative path of the sent mail folder.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.folders.trash
Desc: Relative path of the deleted mail folder.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.getmail.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the getmail mail retriever for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.getmail.delete
Desc:
Enable if you want to delete read messages from the server. Most
users should either enable <code class="literal">delete

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.getmail.destinationCommand
Desc: Specify a command delivering the incoming mail to your maildir.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.getmail.mailboxes
Desc:
A non-empty list of mailboxes. To download all mail you can
use the <code class="literal">ALL

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.getmail.readAll
Desc:
Enable if you want to fetch all, even the read messages from the
server. Most users should either enable <code class="literal">delete

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.gpg
Desc: GPG configuration.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.gpg.encryptByDefault
Desc: Encrypt outgoing messages by default.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.gpg.key
Desc: The key to use as listed in <span class="command"><strong>gpg --list-keys

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.gpg.signByDefault
Desc: Sign messages by default.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.himalaya.enable
Desc: Whether to enable the email client Himalaya CLI for this email account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.himalaya.settings
Desc:
Himalaya CLI configuration for this email account.
See <a class="link" href="https://pimalaya.org/himalaya/cli/latest/configuration/index.html#account-configuration"  target="_top">https://pimalaya.org/himalaya/cli/latest/configuration/index.html#account-configuration

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap
Desc: The IMAP configuration to use for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.host
Desc: Hostname of IMAP server.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.port
Desc:
The port on which the IMAP server listens. If
<code class="literal">null
Type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.tls
Desc: Configuration for secure connections.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.tls.enable
Desc: Whether to enable TLS/SSL.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.tls.certificatesFile
Desc:
Path to file containing certificate authorities that should
be used to validate the connection authenticity. If
<code class="literal">null

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imap.tls.useStartTls
Desc: Whether to use STARTTLS.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imapnotify.enable
Desc: Whether to enable imapnotify.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imapnotify.boxes
Desc: IMAP folders to watch.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imapnotify.extraConfig
Desc: Additional configuration to add for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imapnotify.onNotify
Desc: Shell commands to run on any event.
Type: string or attribute set of string

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.imapnotify.onNotifyPost
Desc: Shell commands to run after onNotify event.
Type: string or attribute set of string

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.jmap
Desc: The JMAP configuration to use for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.jmap.host
Desc: Hostname of JMAP server.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.jmap.sessionUrl
Desc: URL for the JMAP Session resource.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.enable
Desc: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.notmuchSetupWarning
Desc: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings
Desc: Settings which are applied to <code class="filename">.gmailieer.json

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.drop_non_existing_label
Desc: Allow missing labels on the Gmail side to be dropped.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.file_extension
Desc:
Extension to include in local file names, which can be useful
for indexing with third-party programs.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.ignore_empty_history
Desc:
Work around a Gmail API quirk where an empty change history
is sometimes returned.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.ignore_remote_labels
Desc:
Set Gmail labels to ignore when syncing from remote labels to
local tags (before translations).

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.ignore_tags
Desc:
Set labels to ignore when syncing from local tags to
remote labels (after translations).

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.local_trash_tag
Desc: Local tag to which the remote Gmail ‘TRASH’ label is translated.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.remove_local_messages
Desc: Remove local messages that have been deleted on the remote.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.replace_slash_with_dot
Desc: Replace ‘/’ with ‘.’ in Gmail labels.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.settings.timeout
Desc: HTTP timeout in seconds. 0 means forever or system timeout.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.sync.enable
Desc: Whether to enable lieer synchronization service.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.lieer.sync.frequency
Desc: How often to synchronize the account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.maildir
Desc: Maildir configuration for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.maildir.path
Desc:
Path to maildir directory where mail for this account is
stored. This is relative to the base maildir path.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.enable
Desc: Whether to enable synchronization using mbsync.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.create
Desc:
Automatically create missing mailboxes within the
given mail store.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.expunge
Desc:
Permanently remove messages marked for deletion from
the given mail store.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.extraConfig.account
Desc: Account section extra configuration.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.extraConfig.channel
Desc: Per channel extra configuration.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.extraConfig.local
Desc: Local store extra configuration.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.extraConfig.remote
Desc: Remote store extra configuration.
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.flatten
Desc:
If set, flattens the hierarchy within the maildir by
substituting the canonical hierarchy delimiter
<code class="literal">/

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups
Desc:
Some email providers (Gmail) have a different directory hierarchy for
synchronized email messages. Namely, when using mbsync without specifying
a set of channels into a group, all synchronized directories end up beneath
the <code class="literal">[Gmail]/

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels
Desc:
List of channels that should be grouped together into this group. When
performing a synchronization, the groups are synchronized, rather than
the individual channels.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels._name_.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration lines to add to <span class="emphasis"><em>THIS
Type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels._name_.farPattern
Desc:
IMAP4 patterns for which mailboxes on the remote mail server to sync.
If <code class="literal">Patterns

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels._name_.name
Desc:
The unique name for THIS channel in THIS group. The group will refer to
this channel by this name.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels._name_.nearPattern
Desc:
Name for where mail coming from the remote (far) mail server will end up
locally. The mailbox specified by the far pattern will be placed in
this directory.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.channels._name_.patterns
Desc: Instead of synchronizing <span class="emphasis"><em>just

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.groups._name_.name
Desc:
The name of this group for this account. These names are different than
some others, because they will hide channel names that are the same.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.patterns
Desc: Pattern of mailboxes to synchronize.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.remove
Desc: Propagate mailbox deletions to the given mail store.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mbsync.subFolders
Desc:
The on-disk folder naming style. This option has no
effect when <code class="option">flatten

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.msmtp.enable
Desc: Whether to enable msmtp.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.msmtp.extraConfig
Desc: Extra configuration options to add to <code class="filename">~/.msmtprc

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.msmtp.tls.fingerprint
Desc:
Fingerprint of a trusted TLS certificate.
The fingerprint can be obtained by executing
<span class="command"><strong>msmtp --serverinfo --tls --tls-certcheck=off
Type: null or string matching the pattern ([[:alnum:]]{2}:)+[[:alnum:]]{2}

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mu.enable
Desc: Whether to enable mu indexing.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.enable
Desc: Whether to enable mujmap JMAP synchronization for notmuch.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.notmuchSetupWarning
Desc: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings
Desc: Settings which are applied to <code class="filename">mujmap.toml

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.auto_create_new_mailboxes
Desc:
Whether to create new mailboxes automatically on the server from notmuch
tags.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.cache_dir
Desc:
The cache directory in which to store mail files while they are being
downloaded. The default is operating-system specific.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.fqdn
Desc: Fully qualified domain name of the JMAP service.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.password_command
Desc:
Shell command which will print a password to stdout for basic HTTP
authentication.
Type: null or string or list of string

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.session_url
Desc: Session URL to connect to.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags
Desc: Tag configuration.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags.deleted
Desc:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
<code class="literal">Trash

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags.directory_separator
Desc: Directory separator for mapping notmuch tags to maildirs.

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags.important
Desc:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
<code class="literal">Important

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags.inbox
Desc:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
<code class="literal">Inbox

Name: accounts.email.accounts._name_.mujmap.settings.tags.lowercase
Desc:
If true, translate all mailboxes to lowercase names when mapping to notmuch
tags.

Name: launchd.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Home Manager to define per-user daemons by making use
of launchd’s LaunchAgents.

Name: launchd.agents
Desc: Define LaunchAgents.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.enable
Desc: Whether to enable ‹name›.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config
Desc: Define a launchd job. See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">launchd.plist

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.AbandonProcessGroup
Desc:
When a job dies, launchd kills any remaining processes with the same process group ID as the job. Setting
this key to true disables that behavior.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Debug
Desc:
This optional key specifies that launchd should adjust its log mask temporarily to LOG_DEBUG while
dealing with this job.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Disabled
Desc: This optional key is used as a hint to <code class="literal">launchctl(1)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.EnableGlobbing
Desc: This flag causes launchd to use the <code class="literal">glob(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.EnableTransactions
Desc: This flag instructs launchd that the job promises to use <code class="literal">vproc_transaction_begin(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.EnvironmentVariables
Desc:
This optional key is used to specify additional environment variables to be set before running the
job.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.ExitTimeOut
Desc:
The amount of time launchd waits before sending a SIGKILL signal. The default value is 20 seconds. The
value zero is interpreted as infinity.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.GroupName
Desc:
This optional key specifies the group to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root. If UserName is set and GroupName is not, the the group will be set to the default
group of the user.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits
Desc: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with <code class="literal">setrlimit(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.CPU
Desc: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.Core
Desc: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.Data
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the <code class="literal">sbrk(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.FileSize
Desc: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.MemoryLock
Desc: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the <code class="literal">mlock(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
Desc:
The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the <code class="literal">sysctl(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
Desc:
The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the <code class="literal">sysctl(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.HardResourceLimits.Stack
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’s
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.InitGroups
Desc: This optional key specifies whether <code class="literal">initgroups(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.KeepAlive
Desc:
This optional key is used to control whether your job is to be kept continuously running or to let
demand and conditions control the invocation. The default is false and therefore only demand will start
the job. The value may be set to true to unconditionally keep the job alive. Alternatively, a dictionary
of conditions may be specified to selectively control whether launchd keeps a job alive or not. If
multiple keys are provided, launchd ORs them, thus providing maximum flexibility to the job to refine
the logic and stall if necessary. If launchd finds no reason to restart the job, it falls back on
demand based invocation.  Jobs that exit quickly and frequently when configured to be kept alive will
be throttled to converve system resources.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Label
Desc: This required key uniquely identifies the job to launchd.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LaunchEvents
Desc:
Specifies higher-level event types to be used as launch-on-demand event
sources.  Each sub-dictionary defines events for a particular event
subsystem, such as “com.apple.iokit.matching”, which can be used to
launch jobs based on the appearance of nodes in the IORegistry. Each
dictionary within the sub-dictionary specifies an event descriptor that
is specified to each event subsystem. With this key, the job promises to
use the xpc_set_event_stream_handler(3) API to consume events. See
xpc_events(3) for more details on event sources.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LaunchOnlyOnce
Desc:
This optional key specifies whether the job can only be run once and only once.  In other words, if the
job cannot be safely respawned without a full machine reboot, then set this key to be true.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LimitLoadFromHosts
Desc:
This configuration file only applies to hosts NOT listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in <code class="literal">sysctl.conf(5)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LimitLoadToHosts
Desc:
This configuration file only applies to the hosts listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in <code class="literal">sysctl.conf(5)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LimitLoadToSessionType
Desc:
This configuration file only applies to sessions of the type specified. This key is used in concert
with the -S flag to <span class="command"><strong>launchctl

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.LowPriorityIO
Desc:
This optional key specifies whether the kernel should consider this daemon to be low priority when
doing file system I/O.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.MachServices
Desc:
This optional key is used to specify Mach services to be registered with the Mach bootstrap sub-system.
Each key in this dictionary should be the name of service to be advertised. The value of the key must
be a boolean and set to true.  Alternatively, a dictionary can be used instead of a simple true value.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.MachServices.HideUntilCheckIn
Desc:
Reserve the name in the namespace, but cause bootstrap_look_up() to fail until the job has
checked in with launchd.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.MachServices.ResetAtClose
Desc:
If this boolean is false, the port is recycled, thus leaving clients to remain oblivious to the
demand nature of job. If the value is set to true, clients receive port death notifications when
the job lets go of the receive right. The port will be recreated atomically with respect to bootstrap_look_up()
calls, so that clients can trust that after receiving a port death notification,
the new port will have already been recreated. Setting the value to true should be done with
care. Not all clients may be able to handle this behavior. The default value is false.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Nice
Desc: This optional key specifies what nice(3) value should be applied to the daemon.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.OnDemand
Desc:
This key was used in Mac OS X 10.4 to control whether a job was kept alive or not. The default was
true.  This key has been deprecated and replaced in Mac OS X 10.5 and later with the more powerful
KeepAlive option.

Name: none
Desc:
Background jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user.
The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting the
user experience.

Name: none
Desc: Standard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.

Name: none
Desc:
Adaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity over
XPC connections. See <span class="citerefentry"><span class="refentrytitle">xpc_transaction_begin

Name: none
Desc:
Interactive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interactive
jobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only be
used if an app’s ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Program
Desc: This key maps to the first argument of <code class="literal">execvp(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.ProgramArguments
Desc: This key maps to the second argument of <code class="literal">execvp(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.QueueDirectories
Desc:
Much like the WatchPaths option, this key will watch the paths for modifications. The difference being
that the job will only be started if the path is a directory and the directory is not empty.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.RootDirectory
Desc: This optional key is used to specify a directory to <code class="literal">chroot(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.RunAtLoad
Desc:
This optional key is used to control whether your job is launched once at the time the job is loaded.
The default is false.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets
Desc:
This optional key is used to specify launch on demand sockets that can be used to let launchd know when
to run the job. The job must check-in to get a copy of the file descriptors using APIs outlined in
launch(3).  The keys of the top level Sockets dictionary can be anything. They are meant for the application
developer to use to differentiate which descriptors correspond to which application level protocols
(e.g. http vs. ftp vs. DNS…).  At check-in time, the value of each Sockets dictionary key will
be an array of descriptors. Daemon/Agent writers should consider all descriptors of a given key to be
to be effectively equivalent, even though each file descriptor likely represents a different networking
protocol which conforms to the criteria specified in the job configuration file.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.Bonjour
Desc:
This optional key can be used to request that the service be registered with the
<code class="literal">mDNSResponder(8)
Type: null or boolean or list of string

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.MulticastGroup
Desc:
This optional key can be used to request that the datagram socket join a multicast group.  If the
value is a hostname, then <code class="literal">getaddrinfo(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SecureSocketWithKey
Desc:
This optional key is a variant of SockPathName. Instead of binding to a known path, a securely
generated socket is created and the path is assigned to the environment variable that is inherited
by all jobs spawned by launchd.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockFamily
Desc: This optional key can be used to specifically request that “IPv4” or “IPv6” socket(s) be created.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockNodeName
Desc: This optional key specifies the node to <code class="literal">connect(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockPassive
Desc: This optional key specifies whether <code class="literal">listen(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockPathMode
Desc:
This optional key specifies the mode of the socket. Known bug: Property lists don’t support
octal, so please convert the value to decimal.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockPathName
Desc: This optional key implies SockFamily is set to “Unix”. It specifies the path to <code class="literal">connect(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockProtocol
Desc: This optional key specifies the protocol to be passed to <code class="literal">socket(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockServiceName
Desc: This optional key specifies the service on the node to <code class="literal">connect(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Sockets._name_.SockType
Desc:
This optional key tells launchctl what type of socket to create. The default is “stream” and
other valid values for this key are “dgram” and “seqpacket” respectively.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits
Desc: Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with <code class="literal">setrlimit(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.CPU
Desc: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.Core
Desc: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.Data
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the <code class="literal">sbrk(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.FileSize
Desc: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.MemoryLock
Desc: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
Desc:
The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the <code class="literal">sysctl(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
Desc:
The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the <code class="literal">sysctl(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.SoftResourceLimits.Stack
Desc:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’s
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StandardErrorPath
Desc: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stderr when using <code class="literal">stdio(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StandardInPath
Desc:
This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being supplied to stdin when using
<code class="literal">stdio(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StandardOutPath
Desc: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stdout when using <code class="literal">stdio(3)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval
Desc:
This optional key causes the job to be started every calendar interval as specified. Missing arguments
are considered to be wildcard. The semantics are much like <code class="literal">crontab(5)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval._.Day
Desc: The day on which this job will be run.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval._.Hour
Desc: The hour on which this job will be run.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval._.Minute
Desc: The minute on which this job will be run.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval._.Month
Desc: The month on which this job will be run.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartCalendarInterval._.Weekday
Desc: The weekday on which this job will be run (0 and 7 are Sunday).

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartInterval
Desc:
This optional key causes the job to be started every N seconds.  If the system is asleep, the job will
be started the next time the computer wakes up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is
woken, those events will be coalesced into one event upon wake from sleep.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.StartOnMount
Desc: This optional key causes the job to be started every time a filesystem is mounted.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.ThrottleInterval
Desc:
This key lets one override the default throttling policy imposed on jobs by launchd.  The value is in
seconds, and by default, jobs will not be spawned more than once every 10 seconds.  The principle
behind this is that jobs should linger around just in case they are needed again in the near future.
This not only reduces the latency of responses, but it encourages developers to amortize the cost of
program invocation.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.TimeOut
Desc:
The recommended idle time out (in seconds) to pass to the job. If no value is specified, a default time
out will be supplied by launchd for use by the job at check in time.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.Umask
Desc: This optional key specifies what value should be passed to <code class="literal">umask(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.UserName
Desc:
This optional key specifies the user to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.WaitForDebugger
Desc:
This optional key specifies that launchd should instruct the kernel to have the job wait for a debugger
to attach before any code in the job is executed.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.WatchPaths
Desc: This optional key causes the job to be started if any one of the listed paths are modified.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.WorkingDirectory
Desc: This optional key is used to specify a directory to <code class="literal">chdir(2)

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.inetdCompatibility
Desc: The presence of this key specifies that the daemon expects to be run as if it were launched from inetd.

Name: launchd.agents._name_.config.inetdCompatibility.Wait
Desc:
This flag corresponds to the “wait” or “nowait” option of inetd. If true, then the listening
socket is passed via the standard in/out/error file descriptors. If false, then <code class="literal">accept(2)

Name: services.mako.enable
Desc:
Whether to enable Mako, lightweight notification daemon for Wayland
.

Name: services.mako.package
Desc: The mako package to use.

Name: services.mako.actions
Desc:
Applications may request an action to be associated with activating a
notification. Disabling this will cause mako to ignore these requests.

Name: services.mako.anchor
Desc:
Show notifications at the specified position on the output.
Supported values are top-right, top-center, top-left, bottom-right,
bottom-center, bottom-left, and center.

Name: services.mako.backgroundColor
Desc:
Set popup background color to a specific color, represented in hex
color code.

Name: services.mako.borderColor
Desc:
Set popup border color to a specific color, represented in hex color
code.

Name: services.mako.borderRadius
Desc: Set popup corner radius to the specified number of pixels.

Name: services.mako.borderSize
Desc: Set popup border size to the specified number of pixels.

Name: services.mako.defaultTimeout
Desc:
Set the default timeout to timeout in milliseconds. To disable the
timeout, set it to zero.

Name: services.mako.extraConfig
Desc: Additional configuration.

Name: services.mako.font
Desc: Font to use, in Pango format.

Name: services.mako.format
Desc:
Set notification format string to format. See FORMAT SPECIFIERS for
more information. To change this for grouped notifications, set it
within a grouped criteria.

Name: services.mako.groupBy
Desc:
A comma-separated list of criteria fields that will be compared to
other visible notifications to determine if this one should form a
group with them. All listed criteria must be exactly equal for two
notifications to group.

Name: services.mako.height
Desc:
Set maximum height of notification popups. Notifications whose text
takes up less space are shrunk to fit.

Name: services.mako.iconPath
Desc:
Paths to search for icons when a notification specifies a name
instead of a full path. Colon-delimited. This approximates the search
algorithm used by the XDG Icon Theme Specification, but does not
support any of the theme metadata. Therefore, if you want to search
parent themes, you’ll need to add them to the path manually.

Name: services.mako.icons
Desc: Whether or not to show icons in notifications.

Name: services.mako.ignoreTimeout
Desc:
If set, mako will ignore the expire timeout sent by notifications
and use the one provided by default-timeout instead.

Name: services.mako.layer
Desc:
Arrange mako at the specified layer, relative to normal windows.
Supported values are background, bottom, top, and overlay. Using
overlay will cause notifications to be displayed above fullscreen
windows, though this may also occur at top depending on your
compositor.

Name: services.mako.margin
Desc:
Set margin of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to
apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set
vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will
give each edge a separate value.
For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20
and bottom to five.

Name: services.mako.markup
Desc:
If 1, enable Pango markup. If 0, disable Pango markup. If enabled,
Pango markup will be interpreted in your format specifier and in the
body of notifications.

Name: services.mako.maxIconSize
Desc: Set maximum icon size to the specified number of pixels.

Name: services.mako.maxVisible
Desc: Set maximum number of visible notifications. Set -1 to show all.

Name: services.mako.output
Desc:
Show notifications on the specified output. If empty, notifications
will appear on the focused output. Requires the compositor to support
the Wayland protocol xdg-output-unstable-v1 version 2.

Name: services.mako.padding
Desc:
Set padding of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to
apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set
vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will
give each edge a separate value.
For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20
and bottom to five.

Name: services.mako.progressColor
Desc:
Set popup progress indicator color to a specific color,
represented in hex color code. To draw the progress
indicator on top of the background color, use the
<code class="literal">over

Name: services.mako.sort
Desc:
Sorts incoming notifications by time and/or priority in ascending(+)
or descending(-) order.

Name: services.mako.textColor
Desc:
Set popup text color to a specific color, represented in hex color
code.

Name: services.mako.width
Desc: Set width of notification popups in specified number of pixels.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders
Desc: Folders which should be shared by Syncthing.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.enable
Desc:
Whether to share this folder.
This option is useful when you want to define all folders
in one place, but not every machine should share all folders.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.copyOwnershipFromParent
Desc:
On Unix systems, tries to copy file/folder ownership from
the parent directory (the directory it’s located in).
Requires running Syncthing as a privileged user, or
granting it additional capabilities (e.g. CAP_CHOWN on
Linux).

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.devices
Desc:
The devices this folder should be shared with. Each device must

Desc: The ID of the folder. Must be the same on all devices.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.label
Desc: The label of the folder.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.path
Desc:
The path to the folder which should be shared.
Only absolute paths (starting with <code class="literal">/

Desc:
Controls how the folder is handled by Syncthing.
See <a class="link" href="https://docs.syncthing.net/users/config.html#config-option-folder.type"  target="_top">https://docs.syncthing.net/users/config.html#config-option-folder.type

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.versioning
Desc:
How to keep changed/deleted files with Syncthing.

See <a class="link" href="https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html"  target="_top">https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html

Name: services.syncthing.settings.folders._name_.versioning.type

Name: services.syncthing.settings.options.maxFolderConcurrency
Desc:
This option controls how many folders may concurrently be in I/O-intensive operations such as syncing or scanning.
The mechanism is described in detail in a <a class="link" href="https://docs.syncthing.net/advanced/option-max-concurrency.html"  target="_top">separate chapter

Name: services.syncthing.settings.options.relaysEnabled
Desc: When true, relays will be connected to and potentially used for device to device connections.

Name: services.syncthing.settings.options.urAccepted
Desc:
Whether the user has accepted to submit anonymous usage data.
The default, 0, mean the user has not made a choice, and Syncthing will ask at some point in the future.
“-1” means no, a number above zero means that that version of usage reporting has been accepted.

Desc:
Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, fields and RGB color hex-codes as values.
See default values for the reference.
Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.

Desc: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator

Name: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars._.colors.focusedBackground
Desc: Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.

Desc: Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.

Name: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars._.colors.focusedStatusline
Desc: Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

Name: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars._.colors.focusedWorkspace

Desc: Font configuration for this bar.

Desc: The default bar mode when ‘bar.mode’ == ‘hide’.

If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x corresponds
to the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

Note that ‘sway.config.colors.background’ parameter takes a single RGB value.

Desc: Set the execute bit. If <code class="literal">null

Shell commands to run when file has changed between

<span class="emphasis"><em>after

Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific

Whether the target path should be unconditionally replaced

Shell commands to run when file has changed between

<span class="emphasis"><em>after

If the file source is a directory, then this option

Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.
